title: (x) Esquire Magazine - Gotham, Vectora, Mercury Display et al {Kent, Jonathan}
content:
Trying to ID the house fonts for the current design of US Esquire, as well as the Main Sans Serif of US GQ under Woodward. Sorry I dont have any scans. Im aware that both these are probably custom drawn, If anyone has any information on their origins, It would be most appreciated.   
   
Best,   
Jeremy.
author: anonymous

comments.content:
Yes, that's them. Esquire uses my "Mercury Display" typeface, as well as Tobias Frere-Jones' slab serif, formerly known as "Strada" (Albert Pinggera just released a design by the same name, so we're looking for a replacement.)   
   
The GQ face is indeed Gotham, also by Tobias. You can follow the link above.   
   
   
Regards, Jonathan

I haven't seen a copy of Esquire recently, but last I knew they were using Jonathan Hoefler's Mercury for their serif text face and some heads. For sans, I think they've been using a fair bit of Frutiger's [Vectora](http://web.archive.org/web/20121219013708/http:/www.myfonts.com/FontFamily4514.html).   
   
Neither have I seen GQ recently, so I may be mistaken, but I believe that they've been using a version of HTF's [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20121219013708/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html) for their main sans.   
   
Someone who has the magazines at hand (or Jonathan) can confirm.   
   
-- K.
